name: Anasazi Steakhouse
address: 1234 W Sunset Blvd, St. George, UT 84770, USA

reviews.text:
We had a wonderful meal, tonight! The steaks were perfectly cooked, the entire meal was delicious.
Our server, Mark, was fantastic! He made the evening memorable, and quite enjoyable!
We will be returning to sample the rest of the menu!

Five minutes into Anasazi Steakhouse in St. George, I realized I hadnâ€™t just walked into a restaurant, Iâ€™d entered a dimension.

The hostess greeted me with a smile that hinted sheâ€™d seen time bend before. My steak came raw, resting beside a glowing black slab hotter than a thousand suns, as if forged by the ghost of a cowboy who got too close to Zionâ€™s red cliffs.

I cooked it myself while whispering compliments to the sizzling rock, which mightâ€™ve whispered back.

Halfway through, the air smelled like pure destiny and a faint trace of sandalwood, possibly from the neighboring tableâ€™s ribeye sÃ©ance.

My mashed potatoes were so buttery they slipped off the plate and tried to apply for citizenship in another realm.

A server named Gary (or was it Gandalf?) brought molten chocolate fondue that felt like it could heal heartbreak and ignite car alarms.

By dessert, Iâ€™d accepted that this place wasnâ€™t just dinner, it was a ritual. If you stare long enough into your own reflection in the fondue pot, youâ€™ll see your true steak-loving self smiling back.

â€œSteak so good it made my ancestors text me.â€ - Bill Burr, probably.
Every time we visit St George, we make sure we go to Anasazi. The food is always wonderful. We love the cheese fondue and steaks "on the rock". Delicious!
Excellent place for dinner
Awesome Ribeye and Vodka Gimlet

Was in Saturday night and service was slow
It was chaotic and seemed understaffed
Love this place but my server looked like she had too many people to take care of at one time
A bit expensive, especially when you do the cooking yourself. But the meat was excellent!!!

The restaurant was filled with smoke. Took 23 minutes to get drinks. No water offered. Ordered fondue it was good. 1/2 way thru got drinks. The service was horrible. Ordered then they came back 15 minutes later and said they are out. Reordered and the potatoes and vegetables were cold. The steak was average. The service was horrible there i said it again. Older lady and she hated her job. My son ask what type of salad dressings do you have. She replied the common ones. In 60 years I have never heard this before. We wonâ€™t go back and wouldnâ€™t recommend especially for the price.
I spent $45 on a Ribeye Steak that honestly tasted like a $10 sirloin from Dennyâ€™s at best.  Very disappointed and hoping it was just an anomaly.
We LOVED our waiter who made our whole experience amazing !! The food was fabulous and when we come back to St. George we will return !

Experiential dining! We tried the Swiss fondue, which was good. I had the Flatiron and their citrus salad. It's fun to cook your own food, and it was all tasty. Jake, our server, was awesome and let us mix the milk and dark chocolate for dessert, which was excellent. I asked for a spoon, it was so good.

Food was good, but not spectacular.  We had the baseball steak,  and regretted not choosing a better cut, so that was our choice. Mashed potatoes and carrots were wonderful. We were seated right inside the door by hostess desk, so more of a diner atmosphere.
Good food, but service was a bit slow.
My favorite steakhouse in St George! Unique, clean and professional!
This place was recommended to us by a localâ€¦glad we listened!  Fondu and steak, you canâ€™t go wrong! Our server Jessica went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our dinner celebration!
Came here on our little getaway and it was phenomenal. Jake was the absolute best waiter. He was so kind and provided us with the best service possible! Hands down the best steak!

If youâ€™re looking for a fun experience type of restaurant this is a great one to check out. We love brining our out of town guests here to enjoy an interactive meal. Lots of different fondue options from different types of cheese blends served with veggies and bread to their dessert chocolate fondues served with sweet treats and fruit.

If you enjoy a good cocktail that actually does the trick, this is the place and can be hard to find in other southern Utah restaurants.

Jake was our server (9/14) and let me just say, he went above and beyond for our night. It was the last night of our vacation and he made it 10x better. Weâ€™re from Wisconsin and Jake gave us the Anasazi food tour and gave perfect recommendations from drinks all the way through desserts. This was by far our favorite place to eat our entire trip. Thank you Jake and keep killing it in the serving game my guy!ğŸ¤™ğŸ¼
Fantastic food and the best service I have received in Utah. Highly recommend.

Great food and great staff. I would highly recommend to anyone.
Thank you to Mark for having a bowl of soup with us!
I had the special, Hanger Steak with Blackened  Gulf Shrimp, and it was the BEST steak I've ever!!!

First time visit to Anasazi for dinner and server was very helpful and explained available options to prepare my own steak on heated block in middle of my table or traditional method by a cook in their kitchen. Nice selection of meat on the menu and I chose the Flat Iron Steak cooked traditional with a garden salad on the side.
My steak was delicious and cooked medium well according to my instructions. I will visit this restaurant again the next time I'm in St George. Great food and service.
Great spot for a larger group and the service was quick and helpful.

The first rolls we received were so flat I thought theyâ€™d been pressed in a panini maker. If bread could sigh, these were doing it.

The steak I ordered medium well arrived rare, so rare, I half expected it to introduce itself and ask me to stop cutting into it.

The shrimp, on the other hand, got the opposite treatment: overcooked and seasoned like the chef personally went snorkeling to bring back every grain of salt from the ocean.

The scallops? Letâ€™s just say they spent a little too much quality time on the grill. By the time they reached me, all I could taste was char, as if the chef had forgotten them while catching up on a Netflix series.

Service and presentation were fine, but the food felt like a rehearsal dinner, lots of effort, not much polish. For the prices, I expected a culinary symphony. Instead, I got a garage band that hadnâ€™t practiced.

All in all, the evening was certainly memorable and full of surprises. A few dishes wandered off-script, but unfortunately, not in a way that makes me eager for the sequel. St. George has too many great restaurants to roll the dice here again.
so Iâ€™ll leave this one off my recommendation list.

Our first time visiting this restaurant and it was great!
Our waiter Mark, one of the owners, made us feel welcome and was very attentive.
We'll definitely be back!

This was a nice little stop after a long day of off-roading. Was told by local the gas station about it so we went to check it out. It's a nice new building everything's pretty and unique. Right atmosphere inside. Induction stove top built into each table for the multitude of fondue choices.

Amongst us we had fillets and ribeyes. Unique about this place is they will bring you a hot lava stone and you can cook your steak at your table how you like. Or they will cook it for you if you'd rather.

Servers were friendly and things moved along quickly. The fondue was really good with a selection of Breads and vegetables and fruits to dip. The cuts of meat were good and not overly seasoned. All in all I would definitely go back again. You're going to spend about $60 to $75 per person.

The fondues are a big reason my family loves Anasazi, we have never been disappointed with a cheese or chocolate fondue option. And grilling our steaks "on the rocks" makes the dining experience fun and delicious!
Food and atmosphere always good. Had a slight hiccup when we weren't seen for 10 minutes but the manager stepped in and took care of us for rest of the visit.
the best mashed potatoes ever!! the man (I wish I got his name) that helped me at the front was very kind and made my day. thank you!
I have gone here many times, and every time I have gone the food and the service have been nothing short of amazing. P.S I would recommend making a reservation.

We had our year end employee appreciation dinner there. We rented the mezzanine and had a private area to eat and play games.

They took care of us, we had great food and a lot of fun.

This place used to be pretty decent, but lately the service has started to decline. Not sure what changed, but it felt less organized, and cleanliness wasnâ€™t up to the usual standard. Hoping things turn around, because it used to be a reliable spot.

We went Saturday 7/19 @ dinner with 12 people. The place had maybe 5-6 other tables, so it wasn't busy at all fir a Saturday. Had to get our own drink menus, it took 35 mins to order drinks, we were there for an hour before appetizers came out.
Then we had to ask the buss boy to send the waitress for more drinks.
Food came , stone came. Majority cooked on the stone. Steaks were good, everyone's potatoes(mashed or baked were cold) vegetables were cold. I'd imagine steaks would have been cold if we didnt cook them ourselves.
Was in town from out of state ti visit with family.

Fun place, cook your food on a hot stone to the way you like it. Good service and food but it is expensive. We went on a Sunday night as soon as they opened. We been there on a Friday night and it's very busy as expected.

Three adults , way over priced!! got the cheese fondue, barely enough for three. vegs no taste not fresh. salad was dry warm,on a plate that was a small Sauer maybe a half cup steak was ok ive gotten a way better meal at long horn for half the price Won't go backğŸ‘
I donâ€™t normally leave reviews but I was very disappointed in both the service and the food. Terrible service, and sub par food. Iâ€™ll never come back.

Very fun and different! We had fun doing the fondue, we got the California which was delicious, but very rich.  We just shared a steak and with fondue that was more than enough.  Service of great, food was good! The New York strip was slightly too fatty.

Anasazi steakhouse is a great place to eat. The Atmosphere abd service are phenomenal. We celebrated our Anniversay there. You have the option to cook your meat on their hot rocks, this is a fun option.
Also, their fondue desserts are fabulous, the waitress melts the chocolate in front of you on the burner that comes with the table, there is a wide variety of goodies that we were able to dip into the chocolate.

if you could think of any other steakhouse in st. george you should go to it instead of this one. the sign on their door says best in Dixie as of 2022, you can tell itâ€™s been 3 years since that. the service was good but the steak was not, not the mention the knives were too dull to cut the steak that was cooked way to raw. save your time and donâ€™t come to this place ğŸ˜¬

The food was terrible. For $220. it should have been a nice meal for my family of 4.  You literally pay to cook your own food.  The steaks were 90 percent fat and had extraordinary amounts of pepper.  The shrimp was old and fishy.  You literally get a tablespoon  of rice with 4 baby carrots.  The waitress was great and ambience was nice but very very Smokey.

Perfect!!! ë¡œì»¬ì‹ë‹¹ì´ë¼ ì…ì— ë§ì§€ ì•Šìœ¼ë©´ ì–´ì©Œë‚˜ ê±±ì •í–ˆëŠ”ë°.. ë„ˆë¬´ ì˜ë¨¹ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ìŠ¤í…Œì´í¬ëŠ” ë¬¼ë¡  ì‹ì „ë¹µì— ì‚¬ì´ë“œê¹Œì§€ ì™„ë²½í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì €í¬ëŠ” ë¦½ì•„ì´ë‘ ë‰´ìš• ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¦½ ë¨¹ì—ˆëŠ”ë°... ë„ˆë¬´ ë§›ìˆë„¤ìš”. ì‹ ë‘ì€ ë³¸ì¸ì´ ë¨¹ì€ ìŠ¤í…Œì´í¬ì¤‘ ìµœê³ ì˜€ë‹¤ê³  í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ì‹œ ê°€ê³  ì‹¶ì–´ìš”~~~

The steak was very tough and not cooked as ordered! No dinner rolls! The salad was tiny! Blue cheese was fantastic! Very loud down dinning room! Wonâ€™t be back. The porter house was so thin you could see through it!

My waiter ashley was very knowledgable about the menu and made me feel welcomed. I highly recommend getting the bison steak if its in season with mashed potatoes. Carrots and sauteed mushrooms and onions. And the seasonal chocolate and strawberry cocktail was delicious like dessert in a cup. We made no reservation on presidents day weekend and was seated right away upstairs which had nice views of downstairs. Free surface parking lot. Food can be cooked by yourself on a hot stone or by the kitchen. Their big thing is cheese or chocolate fondues as well.  Total bill for two with three drinks was $150.86

Even though the place was packed, We got excellent service. We got two different types of steaks that were perfectly cooked along with the sauces, mashed potatoes were to die for. The toblerone fondue was out of this world and definitely a must try experience. They also let you cook your own steak on your table which makes the experience really unique. Highly recommend

Top-notch food and exceptional service. I had my first chocolate fondue at this restaurant, thinking I would need the sugar for Zion the following day. MJ was the waitress. She went the extra length sitting down with me to go through the menu. Her recommendation was flat iron steak. It was not only cooked perfectly to my liking (medium), but also so well-seasoned that dipping into the steak sauce would be unnecessary. It was a rare occasion that I did not even throw a small chunk of meat away (seamless cut and chew). I didn't expect MJ to prepare the fondue for me (dark chocolate). The plate was overloaded with sweets and fruits. It goes without saying that I took half for breakfast. The walls are decorated with paintings and photography showcasing Utah's rocks and wildlife. Definitely come and try it for yourself if you have the chance to spend a night in St. George. Be warned, come for the steak and you will smell as such ğŸ˜‰.

Bruschetta: Excellent
Southwest Fondue: Good
Scallops: Excellent
Filet Mignon: Okay
Flat Iron Steak: Good
Mashed potatoes: Excellent
Carrots: Excellent
Creme Brulee: Good
Cheesecake: Good
Toffee Cake: EXCELLENT! DIVINE!
Would go again but would try different steaks.

You must try Anasazi Steakhouse.  We enjoyed the New York Steak, filet mignon, Avocado Salad and the chocolate peanut butter fondue.  Every bite of steak was perfect because you cook your meat on a hot rock at your table.  We will definitely be back next time we are in St. George.

We were a group of 12 so we were seated in a big open room with other large parties. It felt like a church dinner rather than a nice restaurant.  The other/small party side of the restaurant appeared a little nicer at a glance.
The prices are a little high compared to the quality of the food, however, it probably has more to do with the unique menu of fondue options and the HOT STONE every entre can come with where you get to cook your meat to your liking.
It is nice that you can opt for the stone or the kitchen will cook your meat if you don't want the "do it yourself" experience.
Towards the end of the meal I began to notice all the smoke/steam in the room from all the individuals cooking their meat. Didn't bother me too much but it encouraged me not to linger after dinner and our clothes and jackets still smelled like meat the next day.
All in all, I enjoyed the experience. But I don't believe I'll be back unless I bring grandkids or someone I think would get a kick out of cooking their own meat.
I do recommend sharing if you go so you can taste and try many things.
4 of us shared 1 fondue, 2 entrÃ©s and a fondue dessert. It was more than enough. We upgraded the 2 salads that come with the meal. I will say their Caesar salad was probably my favorite part and it was plenty for 2 of us. We had the California dreaming fondue. I didn't think it was cheesy enough and preferred our other friends' pretzel and cheese fondue. My friend preferred ours because she doesn't like cheese. Request rolls!!! We thought they just bring them, but apparently not.
Rib eye and chicken were alright. Shrimp ğŸ‘ğŸ». The rosemary garlic mashed potatoes were good but cold so I threw them on my hot stone. Loved their sweet carrots! We had the caramel chocolate fondue. That was really good but not enough items to dip and finished. If only we had a spoon, we would have scraped the bowl! They do serve fish, btw.

Oh man! I just fell in love with this place tonight! It was our first time here, a friend referred us and it didnâ€™t disappoint. The staff was amazing ğŸ¤© Jessica helped us navigate a great menu.
I was also blown away with how soft the buffalo stake was. Chocolate fondue ğŸ«• was the perfect ğŸ‘Œ dessert.

This was so much fun! We had fondue pot for an appetizer and it was so delicious but it was a lot of food and we were almost full before we got our main course! Cooking on the rock was a fun experience and it was nice to get to cook it to our liking (rare for me).

Second time here and absolutely love it. Ambience comfortable, Jessica our server was wonderful and engaging but the food is really terrific. Stuffed mushrooms so juicy and flavorful made me want more. I had the flat iron steak andâ€¦

This was an unforgettable experience. I had never had steak served on a hot rock before this and can't imagine never having it as an option again.

Every bite is hot and smoky, cut right from the sizzling slab. The steak is seasoned to perfection and the unique experience only makes it all the more memorable.

For appetizers, we got Shrimp Cocktail and Stuffed Mushrooms. The shrimp was plump and bouncy to the bite, the acidity of the cocktail sauce perfectly heightened the shrimp's natural flavor. The stuffed mushrooms were a welcome and heart warming delight of pesto flavors.

The waitress was very professional and friendly, she was genuinely happy to see us thrilled at the experience. Anasazi's is a style that I'll remember and hope to revisit again in the near future.

An amazing experience for yourself or with friends! My wife and I experienced this Steakhouse for the first time and we were greeted with enthusiasm. We didn't have a reservation however we were seated within 10 minutes. Our server Mark who is also part owner and the Bartender, served us a great feast. He answered our questions and I was pleased to be informed. Mark is very jovial and very funny. He pours a strong drink with a specialty he creates. The menu was delicious, with many different cheese choices of Fondue appetizer and a ğŸ”¥HOT Rock to cook your personalized entrÃ©e meat choice. And they also have a desert fondue that can be a meal in itself with so many choices of chocolate fondue they are hard to decide which one fits your palette. Price worth every penny for the portions!

Huge disappointment! After hearing the hype about this place for 3 years, we finally gave it a try.   My husband ordered the Porterhouse & its was the thinnest Porterhouse weâ€™ve ever seen. I ordered the New York strip. Both steaks were tough, overcooked & not quality meats. Served a very small salad to start. Steaks were accompanied by a small scoop of mashed potatoes & carrots. We noticed others around us getting some kind of bread w/ their salads but we did not. I asked about it & our server said it was on a â€œask basisâ€. We questioned what that meant & she said people that come regularly know to ask. But since she knew this was our first visit, I asked, how would we know that?! And how expensive could a roll be with the prices they charge for their meals! Maybe they should try even Texas Roadhouseâ€™s generosity with rolls! Wonâ€™t be back & definitely wonâ€™t recommended.

They can bring the stake out in super hot stones and keep it cooking while you eat, if you desire. I like to fillet it in half length wise and let it sizzle in butter. The desert chocolate fondue is yummy. The cheese fondue as the appetizer was good, but not great. The waitress was over the top on everything.

The steak is very well seasoned and the Toblerone chocolate fondue was very good.  And they bring a platter of good things to dip in the chocolate. They bring the steak out seared then you cook it on a hot rock. I got the NY strip and it was very good.

This was my second time going and it was delicious. Both the cheese and chocolate fondue are delicious and a must. I recommend the southwest blend. There may be leftover but you can ask to take it home! The steak on the rock is delicious - this time I got a ribeye - but as some others have commented: unless you trust your grill mastery, for best flavor Iâ€™d leave it to the pros in the back. Otherwise, cooking on the rock is just for the experience and fun of it. The atmosphere is great for all - you can go casual or you can go fancy, you wonâ€™t feel out of place.

Anasazi Steak is probably one of the best steak restaurants I've been to! And I've been to a few in Park City, Salt Lake, and Southern Utah! Great cooks, great cuts, and great food. Very well done 4.8/5.

Before we get into the steaks, I will be a little opposite of most reviews and even the "specialty reason" people go to Anasazi. I actually do not recommend the Hot Stone cook, but if you want the experience please don't let me deter you! The only reason I say this is that most people we have seen get the stone overcook their steak fast, discard a lot of it, and it just can not get the same flavor as a char-grilled steak. It's very cool, and a very fun option, but for the quality of local sourced, grass-fed meat you get and pay for, I'll let the pros in the back grill!

I was fortunate enough to be able to have the special 30 Day Dry-Aged New York this trip. The size of the strip was fantastic, the seasoning was great, but the cook was one of the best medium-rares I have ever seen on a steak. Grill marks were perfect, and it is all Fire Char-Grilled, which you just can not beat the flavor that they grill that in. The umami flavor, the freshness, the cook was just incredible. We also ordered the regular New York, and it was just a great beef flavor, so well seasoned, and a good tender/fat ratio. One of my favorite parts was the Pesto-Cilatro Scallops appetizer. The sauce was so robust and flavorful, so fresh, and the scallops again perfectly cooked. I would get it if I were you every time! The sides are good, nothing special, and very small portioned, but you do want the steak to be the best thing on that plate in the end. The price does justify the steaks, but again, the sides could be elevated to get that perfect 5 stars. Service was also good. Great job, we'll be back!

Great food and great experience. Definitely get a reservation as it is rather popular. I highly recommend doing the challenge of cooking your meat on the hot stone yourself. A helpful hint, take the meat off the stone when they bring it out and then cut off and cook smaller bite-sized pieces. Do not forget to save room for the dessert chocolate fondue.

I don't usually order seafood so far away from the ocean; however, both times I've had it here, it has been DELICIOUS! We had the pistachio-crusted halibut, filet mignon (on the rock), stuffed mushrooms and chocolate caramel fondue, it was incredible! Our server (Jessica) was PHENOMENAL! Don't be scared by the prices, the food is definitely worth every penny!

It was an experience. Cooking on the stone was different, but not my favorite. I had a lot of smoke in my face and the grease splatters all over the table and your shirt. Steak was good though, quality cut of meat that was seasoned well.

Servers were nice, but didnâ€™t really come around much and it took over an hour to get our food.

I got the 4 oz chicken grilled by the chef and it is the perfect meal size for me and so delicious. Others in our group got steaks and cooked them on the rock and loved that, the cheese fondue was also amazing! Apples are surprisingly GREATâ€¦

This place is somewhere you HAVE to eat at least 1 time in your life. The idea is that you order meat (of your choice in type and size), and cook it yourself at your seat. This is done via a cooking stone that is brought out to you. Theâ€¦

This was a great place to have a steak. The atmosphere is simple, but they have the option available for you to cook your own meat on a 600-degree "rock." I got the porterhouse, and it was great. I wish the sides were a little larger, but they were also very good. The Cesar salad was great, and so was the crem brulee.
